page.title: 03SHILLINGSTONE SCHOOL
page.content: The school was started by Canon Dayman,Rector of Shillingstone and formerly a Senior Proctor of Oxford University,in 1855.At that time it was one room(the present hall).25 years later a second classroom was addded for the Infants.Few additions were made after that until recently.In the last 10 years a kitchen, Staffroom,Junior room and corridors providing covered access to the toilets have been added.the latest addition is the subject of the following page.The school provides for children aged 4 to 11,after which they move to the High School at Sturminster Newton.It is a community school involving all sections of the village and receives a remarkable amount of support from the community,both financially and in other ways.
